results.title: Board games
results.brief_description: These were the television shows that became a part of our family, like relatives that came by to visit a few nights a week. There were hosts that audiences loved, guests they often didn’t and formats so recognisable they felt like a warm blanket. Board game versions of our most popular quiz shows were another way these programmes embedded themselves in our lives. The games allowed us to imagine finding a romantic partner on Perfect Match or walking away with cash prizes on The Price Is Right. Even as game-show formats changed on the small screen, the version inside the box lived on.

constellations_other.name: Australian TV in the 1980s
constellations_other.description: Australian television in the 80s really began to find its footing with mainstream hits becoming landmarks of the industry.

results.title: Board and care
results.creator_credit: Sarah Pillsbury, Ron Ellis and National Endowment for the Arts
results.brief_description: Deals with a Down’s Syndrome girl and boy who reveal the deep human need for communication and sharing. Ricky and Lila meet for a brief afternoon of innocent closeness, eating together and talking about what they see. When Lila is sent away to school, Ricky vainly searches the town for her. Featuring Richard Cross as Ricky and Laura Jean Ellis as Lila. (Academy Award Winner in 1980) Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: BMX Bandits
results.creator_credit: Nilsen Premiere, Tom Broadbridge, Paul F. Davis and Brian Trenchard-Smith
results.brief_description: Action filled fun entertainment, BMX Bandits stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Nilsen Premiere, Tom Broadbridge, Paul F. Davis and Brian Trenchard-Smith
results.description: PJ, Goose and Judy are three teenagers saving to buy BMX bikes. In their efforts, they stumble across a case of smuggled walkie-talkies needed by a bunch of crooks for their next job. Accidentally, while testing them, the teenagers alert the police on the same airwave band. The rest of the film becomes a BMX packed chase as the crooks and the police seek the trio. Action filled fun entertainment, “BMX bandits” stars a very young Nicole Kidman, David Argue and John Ley.

results.title: BMX
results.creator_credit: Chaparral Productions Inc and Lew Adams
results.brief_description: Follows the progress of a BMX race. An exciting film in which cyclists dodge mudholes, leap humps, shave corners and glide in slow motion. Useful for language arts, film making, art, social studies as a discussion starter or to spark a creative writing experience.
results.description: Follows the progress of a BMX race. An exciting film in which cyclists dodge mudholes, leap humps, shave corners and glide in slow motion. Useful for language arts, film making, art, social studies as a discussion starter or to spark a creative writing experience.

results.title: Blush = Hong fen
results.creator_credit: Beijing Salon Films, Ocean Films, Chen Kunming, Cheng Zhigu, Jimmy Tan and Li Shaohong
results.brief_description: Qiuyi and Xiaoe are friends and prostitutes, working in a Shanghai brothel at the end of the 1940’s. It is a time of social upheaval as the Communist Revolution forces them to change their profession and assume ‘normal’ lives. With this normalacy comes trouble, as they both fall in love with the same man. The strain begins to show in their relationship and the two become separated when Quiyi escapes imprisonment by hiding in the home of a former client and Xiaoe becomes trained as a uniformed factory worker. Described as belonging to the renaissance of Asian Cinema, “Blush” is as much about the challenges faced by women during social upheaval as it is about revolutionary change. Cast includes He Saifei and Wang Zhiwen In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Blurred
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Chris Brown, Chris Fitchett and Evan Clarry
results.brief_description: ‘Its not about the destination but the journey’ is an appropriate cliche to describe this teenage road movie - a group of Year 12 students finish high school and set out by bus, train and car to get to “Schoolies Week” celebrations at the Gold Coast in Queensland. This teenage comedy has a rocking soundtrack that emphasises the excitement as these youth find themselves without boundaries and without parental supervision - they all seek the hedonism of a sex, drugs and rock n’ roll ethos that they think will help them ‘party hard’. But for some along the way old relationships are challenged and a new dynamic emerges as some friends come-of-age on their travels and others simply end up with terrific hangovers. Based on a play by Stephen Davis. Cast includes Tony Brockman, Travis Cotton, Jamie Croft, Jessica Gower, Craig Horner, Mark Priestley, Charlotte Rees, Nathalie Roy, Kristian Schmid, Veronica Sywak, Petra Yared, and Matthew Newton. — Mate (prod. Jan Aird, 1997, 10min.) This witty short film also by filmmaker Evan Clarry is included in the special features. Shot on location in Far North Queensland it is the story of two mates who make a promise to each other that should they die, their remains should be cut up and fed to the local crocodiles. Cast includes Damien Garvey and Andy McDonell.

results.title: Bluestone
results.brief_description: The prospect of demolition and destruction of several historic bluestone buildings dating back to the 1850s was eventually avoided through public opinion and a resulting classification by the Housing Heritage Trust. This documentary is of great historical value.
